form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES
form.official-title: To amend title 44, United States Code, to remove pronouns from such title that reference the Archivist, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) Modernization Act.
Title 44, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 710, by striking his approval and inserting approval by the President;
in section 711, by striking he shall and inserting the Director shall;

subparagraph.text: by striking transferred to him and inserting transferred to the Archivist;
by striking appear to him and inserting appear to the head of the Federal agency;
by striking his custody and inserting the custody of the head of the Federal agency;
by striking he concurs, and inserting the Archivist concurs;
by striking his successor in function, each place it appears, and inserting the successor in function of the head of the agency; and
by striking he determines and inserting the Archivist determines;
by striking to him and inserting to the Archivist; and
by striking He may and inserting The Archivist may;
by striking he considers and inserting the Archivist considers; and
by striking his custody and inserting the custody of the Archivist;
by striking he may, each place it appears, and inserting the Archivist may;
by striking in him and inserting in the Archivist;
by striking his custody and inserting the custody of the Archivist; and
by striking his control and inserting the control of the Archivist;

paragraph.text: in section 2307, by striking his designee and inserting the designee of the Archivist;
in section 2903, by striking by him and inserting by the Archivist;
in section 3308, by striking he may and inserting the Archivist may;
in section 3310, by striking he considers and inserting the Archivist considers; and

subparagraph.text: by striking his legal custody and inserting the legal custody of the head of the agency of the United States Government;
by striking his opinion and inserting the opinion of such head of such agency;
by striking he shall and inserting such official shall; and
by striking he disposed and inserting such official disposed.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives December 14, 2022.
